National Cultural Association established the Museum in 1972 on Panditji's name on his birthday. Today when a child walks into Nehru Children's Museum, he walks into a world of treasure. It touches the imaginative mind and encourages him to know more. The exhibits in the museum which are spread over 4 floors, enable a child to take off to the world of epics, the world of science and to dream.

Dolls gallery, Toys gallery, Ramayana & Mahabharata in clay models are the most fascinating archives for the children.

The Museum remains open for all between 11 am and 6 pm on Wednesday through Sunday. The Museum remains closed for the public on Mondays and Tuesdays.

Very nice place for kids. Kids can join plenty of activities like wall painting, canvas painting, robotics, music etc. there is excellent ramayan story depicted in photos. Highly recommend

Given above are the images of a robotic activity. Centrally located. Nearest metro station is Rabindra sadan. (2 minutes walk)

A heaven of dolls and figurines. A museum solely based on dolls is itself quite interesting. Dolls and figurines of all kinds (so many variations) are exhibited here along with the history and stories behind them. An impressive collection of dolls of different countries as well as India. Innumerable amount of figurines of different shape, size, colour, style, clothes claims appreciation and reverence for the artists. Getting tired by seeing so many dolls are natural. Ticket price is different for adults and kids.

Located near Chowringhee Road, Nehru Children‚Äôs Museum is a wonderful place for children to learn through visuals and creativity. The museum features a large collection of dolls from around the world, beautifully dressed in traditional attire, offering a glimpse into global cultures.

It also has detailed model displays of the Ramayana and Mahabharata, helping kids understand Indian epics in a simple and visual way. The Ganesha Gallery and various toys on display make the visit enjoyable for all age groups.

The museum is clean, affordable, and easy to reach. It‚Äôs a quiet and educational space that sparks curiosity in young minds.

Timings: 11 AM ‚Äì 6 PM (Closed on Monday & Tuesday)
Entry Fee: ‚Çπ10 (children), ‚Çπ20 (adults)
Nearest Metro: Rabindra Sadan or Park Street

If you have a kid and specially girl than you must visit this museum.
Basically it is a doll museum.
You can see different kind of dolls from every corner of world.
1st 2nd 3rd floor is full with doll & history of ramayana & mahavarat is displayed by dolls.
Situated at Exide more or rabindra sadan crossing opposite of haldiram.
Ticket price is 20rs for more than 16yrs and 10rs for less than 16yrs.
Cultural program likes song, dance, drawing etc also done here at 5th & 6th floor.
& Exibition also organised here.

This place is awesome...
2 floors are full of Doll, many types of Dolls are can be seen here.
Dolls of every country are stocked here. Also with their traditions look..
Also have indian mythology part
"RAMAYANA" with statue and writing story..

It will be a great things to see for children and adults also...

Ticket price- 30/- (per head)
Close- Monday
Timing- 11am - 4pm
Nice place for kids. My 5 years daughter enjoyed a lot, specially Ramayana.
Great educational museum for kids. But I can't think of a museum without air conditioning. It was hot inside - uncomfortable.

placeMetadata.name: Nalban Park

sources.snippet: Located at Salt Lake, this boating park is home to the city's largest water body. Perfect place for a beautiful boat ride with your partner accompanied with tasty fish delicacies from Nalban food plaza and long lazy strolls. Plenty of Rooms for unmarried couples are available near the park , Luxury hotels in salt lake kolkata are also available.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic places in Kolkata perfect for a date with your girlfriend

placeMetadata.description: Compact, palm-dotted park popular for sunset watching, with restaurants, paths & animals.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nalban Park is a compact and picturesque destination in Kolkata, offering a variety of activities for visitors. The park features palm-dotted paths, restaurants, and opportunities to observe animals. It's a popular spot for sunset watching and water sports enthusiasts will find plenty of options here. Boating is a highlight, with paddle boating, shikara rides, and rowing boats available on the lake.
placeMetadata.address: HC9J+985, Street Number 27, HM Block, Nalban Bheri, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700106, India

reviews.reviewText: When I visited there I saw a very calm scenario in front of my eyes and the beautiful moon. Yes, it's like one of the typical couple parks but the view and calmness is much more than that. A person can easily love this place  and for those who like to have deep conversation with their partner this place is a cherry on the cake. I will definitely visit there again and again.
Good place for spending time with nature and your beloved one. Families better stay away. Ticket 30 per head. Bike 10 per hour.

I'm giving 4 just because they're not consistent, one day you would love their one day it will be average, it's not fixed depends on your luck I must say.

But yeah pocket friendly and a nice place to have lunch I must say, this is completely a non veg restaurant i would say. There are veg options tooo.

Good place for picnic they have a restaurant as well.. this place is adjacent to huge water body and give very nice vibes during winters..also small Birthday parties and other gatherings can be arranged here..

Nalban park has beautiful PICNIC SPOTS just opposite of SDF MORE. We booked the spot which can be entered through gate no 3 . This picnic spot is not that beautiful or mesmerizing or well decorated. Even the ground is not that large . There is a huge parking place obviously chargeable. There is a house where lunch or tiffin is arranged. However, the picnic spot is so so . One can reach here from SALT LAKE SECTOR V METRO STATION.
The park was good but there were some places broken. Maybe they will rebuild them.

I had visited this place with my neighbourhood  as a picnic destination. I am impressed by the calm serene environment of this place I loved the huge water body. It is like a edge of nature and city life beautiful and exciting. It is near Salt Lake sector 5 . Sector V is Kolkata's  one of the most modern palaces.

Nice quiet environment for people want spend some quite or quality time.. But the place is so small....but one of the best thing is the sunset... It's awesome... I really enjoyed it...one more thing don't stare at other couples... They might not feel disturbed but you willüòÖüòÖ
Thanks in advance if it is helps.

placeMetadata.name: Raj's Spanish Cafe

sources.snippet: You wouldn‚Äôt expect this to be on a date night list, but hear me out. The rustic charm and the brick-oven aroma are enough to make anyone fall in love (with the place, not the person). Plus there‚Äôs an antique store right next door where you can buy your date some funky jewellery or a handcrafted journal.
sources.shortName: 6 Of The Most Romantic Spots In Kolkata So You Don't Disappoint Your Date

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Raj's Spanish Cafe is a charming eatery located in the alleys of Sudder Street, offering delicious woodfire pizzas and authentic Italian recipes passed down by Italian patrons. The cafe also features a microbrewery, making it one of the unique spots in Kolkata. With its cozy ambiance and delectable food selection including Spanish, Italian, Mexican, and American snacks, this cafe is sure to leave every foodie impressed.
placeMetadata.address: 7, Sudder St, Fire Brigade Head Quarter, New Market Area, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700016, India

reviews.reviewText: It's a nice cozy cafe for a hangout. The food is as good as its reviews. A good place to try its thin crust pizzas, lasagnas, and other continental cuisines. You can sit inside the cafe or outside in the open air. It is well decorated with plants and hanging table lamps. Don't miss the wall arts and graffiti. If you want to be creative you can always contribute to the graffiti.

If only I could have lifetime supply of iced latte from this cafe üòÅ
Enjoyed the buttery croissant, garlic pasta with fried chicken, funghi pizza and the blueberry cheesecake a lot.
Looking forward to trying more options when I visit next. Loved the cozy ambience too.

The vibes were immaculate...

I have visited this place twice. Their service was very good. For advice, I can say that they can make a little bit of change in taste of foods as in chicken combo,pollo was pretty dry. Otherwise most of the dishes taste good. And the show winner is Tiramisu üôå. Although, It was a good experience. ü§ó

Here you can experience authentic continental cuisine.üòç
It serves wood  fire pizza..üçï
Overall it was a good dine in.
Ambience is nice.

We triedüëá
Garlic pasta fried chicken -‚Çπ320
Lasgna de pollo- ‚Çπ310
Chicken Burger combo-‚Çπ290
Poho e funghi(pizza)-‚Çπ500

Finding this hidden gem might be tricky for the first timers but once you reach this place you understand the hype behind it. The cafe has both open area as well as dine in area. We opted to sit outside under the evening sky and ordered their cappuccino
The coffee was decent
We then ordered their spaghetti carbonara along with patata frites. The spaghetti was delicious and the patata frites had a nice crunch and tasted fresh. The best part is that you can stay there as long as you want and spend some quality time with friends. The place has a hispter kind of vibe so I won't recommend to come with your family. Overall, a good cafe with a beautiful atmosphere.

Raj Spanish Cafe is a delightful culinary gem that transports your taste buds to the vibrant flavors of Spain, Mexico, and Italy, all without emptying your wallet. This charming cafe boasts an impressive menu with a wide range of incredibly tasty dishes from these beloved cuisines, ensuring there's something to satisfy every craving. From authentic Spanish tapas and hearty Mexican enchiladas to classic Italian pasta and pizzas, the quality and flavor profiles are truly exceptional.
What sets Raj Spanish Cafe apart is their commitment to traditional cooking methods, notably their traditional oven. This likely imparts a unique and delicious character to their pizzas and perhaps other dishes, adding an extra layer of authenticity and flavor that you won't find everywhere. The aroma alone is enough to entice you!
Beyond the delicious and affordable food, Raj Spanish Cafe likely offers a warm and inviting ambiance, perfect for a casual meal with friends, a cozy date, or even a solo culinary adventure. The staff are probably friendly and attentive, enhancing the overall positive experience. If you're looking for a cafe that offers a fantastic variety of tasty Spanish, Mexican, and Italian dishes at an affordable price, with the added charm of a traditional oven, Raj Spanish Cafe is an absolute must-visit. It's a true find for food lovers seeking both quality and value.

Went for breakfast on a rainy Saturday morning. We were the only people in the cafe. Fair to say we enjoyed the tranquility and of course, the food.

We ordered the Chicken combo- which  was decent. The chicken was well seasoned and fried till GBD. The fries were crunchy, but the salad on the side could do with more dressing.
We also ordered the Spaghetti Carbonara which was delectable and the pasta was cooked al dente. The dish was one sprinkle parmesan short of a hearty and sumptuous meal (although, when is more cheese ever enough?).
We settled for an iced mocha to wash down our fair share of carbs, which rightly hit the spot.

Overall, an experience that was made even better by the constant light to heavy drizzle outside.

No amount of funk or cool hangouts will ever  top the serendipity of having the entire cafe to ourselves on a rainy Saturday morning.

Tummy full, soul satisfied.

God bless chicken, potatoes, spaghetti, and cheese.

Have been going to this place for a few years. One of a kind menu featuring items from around the world - with a special emphasis on authentic Spanish and Mexican dishes. Also they serve one of the best breakfasts in the city, and are open from 8 in the morning. Prices are very reasonable, considering the items they offer and the kind of customers they get (mostly foreigners since there are many hotels nearby catering to international tourists).
They allow visitors to scribble on the walls with a permanent marker, and it makes for an unique setting. In the evenings there is a nice lively ambience when the place is full of Europeans and other world travelers. Only negatives are the lack of proper washroom and restroom facilities (they have this pretty basic and makeshift toilet and hand-washing space), and the lack of signs and directions leading to the caf√© (it is almost 'hidden' in a small bylane away from the street).
Today I had Tortilla De Patatas (potatoes wrapped in an omlette), Albondigas (meat balls) with fries, fresh watermelon juice, and black coffee with double shot of espresso (fully recommend - its the strongest coffee in town!). All for only ‚Çπ590.

placeMetadata.name: Ozora

sources.snippet: Ozora is one of the best romantic restaurants for couples who happen to enjoy upbeat vibes and zesty music, then Ozora is where you ought to be headed to for a romantic yet exciting evening with your significant other. Crowned on the whopping 20th floor of Acropolis Mall in Kasba, it has a stunning and spacious rooftop dining space that offers THE MOST spellbinding view of the city. At Ozora, you can unwind from the week's stress and relish a passionate conversation with someone you deeply admire.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

placeMetadata.description: Vibrant terrace seating pub & restaurant with multicuisine options & sports screenings.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Ozora is a vibrant terrace seating pub and restaurant located on the twentieth floor of Acropolis Mall in Kasba, Kolkata. It offers a stunning view of the city, making it an ideal spot for a romantic evening. The venue specializes in tea-based cocktails and mocktails, offering unique options like Te Basilica and Tam Bram Thank You Maam.
placeMetadata.address: 20 Floor, 1858, Acropolis Mall, Rajdanga Main Rd, Kolkata, West Bengal 700107, India

reviews.reviewText: It is a great pleasure to experience such kind of ambiance with food and drinks. I like the ambience heavenly and also the quality of food is great. We visit often here to enjoy the beautiful environment of the place and spent a good quality time. 3000/4000 Rupees is enough for a couple including drinks.

**Ozora, Kolkata: A Brief Review**

**Ambiance & Atmosphere**:
Ozora offers an elegant yet lively rooftop dining experience with panoramic views of Kolkata. The interior features contemporary decor, warm lighting, and comfortable seating, making it ideal for evening gatherings.

**Service Quality**:
While some guests appreciate the attentive staff, there are mixed reviews about service. Some mention professional service, while others highlight untrained staff and issues with drink preparation.

**Food & Drink**:
The menu offers a variety of cuisines with flavorful dishes. However, feedback on drink quality varies, with some noting that cocktails lack expertise.

**Cleanliness & Hygiene**:
Details on cleanliness are limited, but as a premium venue, it likely adheres to standard hygiene protocols.

**Value for Money**:
While prices reflect the premium setting and views, some feel the quality of service and drinks doesn't justify the cost.

**Overall Experience**:
Ozora provides a unique dining experience with stunning views but mixed service and drink quality. It's worth visiting for special occasions, but experiences may vary.

Had a wonderful evening at Ozora ‚Äì the ambiance was simply stunning! Dining on the rooftop of the 20th floor offered breathtaking views of the city skyline. The atmosphere was elegant yet relaxed, perfect for both a romantic date or a casual hangout with friends.

The food was delicious ‚Äì every dish was beautifully presented and full of flavor. The staff was warm, courteous, and attentive, making the experience even more memorable. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for good vibes, great food, and an unforgettable rooftop experience! üçΩ‚ú®

Ozora is situated on the 20th floor of Acropolis mall. It has a separate entrance and lift . When we went there for lunch on a weekday the place was empty. We ordered two mocktails...one spicy mango drink and the other was bengal twist...gandhoraj mojito. Both were very refreshing. There was a set menu displayed on the table. So we ordered one continental set meal. The food was just average. Then we ordered pepperoni pizza. The pizza was just too good. Then we ordered one raspberry cheesecake and tiramisu for dessert. Both were ok. The place had great view of the city. The person serving Mr. Atish Barick was very knowledgeable about the menu. He was a pleasure to have as a steward. One thing though they had added service charge to the bill .
The ambience is really great. Service was awesome. Vej options are slightly better. We had Sunday Brunch. Without alcohol 1650+ and with  alcohol 2750.

I honestly have nothing but praise for this place. The experience begins the moment you push open the large glass door, as you're welcomed by a breathtaking view of the cityscape.

I went there with three friends for lunch. We ordered Korean Chilli Wings, a Pepperoni Rucola Pizza, and two glasses of fresh lime soda. The service was prompt, and it was impossible not to blurt out "mmm, delicious" after every bite. There's a bar right next to the dining area, which we youngsters didn‚Äôt venture into.

The ambience couldn't have been better‚Äîsoft jazz playing in the background, the occasional clink of cutlery‚Äîit all came together so well. The bill came to slightly under Rs. 2000, which feels a bit pricey for what we ordered, but honestly, it was worth it.

The outdoor seating area is likely too hot to enjoy on a midsummer afternoon, though I bet it's absolutely charming in the evening. Definitely recommended if you're in the mood for a quick exotic hangout‚Äîor simply feeling a bit spendthrift.

The view is excellent! Make sure to seat in the outdoor section.
Food is average, not overly good but certainly not bad. They have a non refundable cover charge of 1000‚Çπ which seemed unnecessary as the place didn't have so much to offer.

The tables are too small and the high chairs are quite uncomfortable. They really need to work on that.
Also we were disturbed by these two young ladies using their camera flash too often while shooting reels right next to us ruining our experience. The staff didn't seem to do anything in this regard so I had to ask them to stop.

One of the best rooftop restaurants in Kolkata..
The food was exceptionally good
The service was great
We sat indoor as it was hot and humid outdoors but you can go to the rooftop to enjoy the view..

placeMetadata.name: Nandan

sources.snippet: Nandan is the film and cultural hub in Kolkata aiming to encourage and felicitate cinematic awareness in society. Surrounded by impressive architectural buildings, Nandan is a popular place for youngsters and aged people equally and also a hub for art lovers. from literature to art to cinema, Nandan is one of the most romantic places in Kolkata.
sources.shortName: 31 Best Romantic Places in Kolkata for Couples [2023]

placeMetadata.address: 1 1, Acharya Jagdish Chandra Bose Rd, Maidan, Kolkata, West Bengal 700020, India

reviews.reviewText: This is one the most beautiful cultural place of the city, Kolkata. Basically a govt sponsored film & cultural centre. This place can offer you several things at a time. For me, I often visit here for watching cinema & you can also have an evening chat with friends. The place become bustling with dancing, singing in the evening. Lots of options for fooding outside in the premise. The ticket price is very pocket friendly, good for the school or college students. There are 3 screens. Nandan 1 is the largest in capacity, I guess. I watched several cinema here. You can feel that the seating arrangement is not that good, not enough leg space, even you can't push your seat back like many others offer. But at this price point, this should be normal. Other 2 screens are comparatively smaller that the first one. The place is very easy to access. The area quite a big with a water body behind & is very clean.

Visited Nandan Kolkata recently and really liked the vibe of the place. It has this calm, artistic charm and is always buzzing with people - from film lovers to college students just hanging around. What makes it even more special is that the iconic filmmaker Satyajit Ray was actually involved in designing the logo and played a key role in shaping the idea of Nandan. You can really feel that cultural and creative energy here. Watched a film, walked around a bit, and clicked a few photos which I've shared here. If you're in Kolkata and love cinema or just want a peaceful spot to relax, definitely give Nandan a visit.

Nandan is the cultural heartbeat of Kolkata‚Äîa perfect blend of cinema, art, and nostalgia. From classic films to vibrant festivals, it‚Äôs a haven for movie lovers. Peaceful ambience, affordable tickets, and intellectual vibes make it a must-visit for every Kolkatan.

Excellent place to hangout.
The movie theatre is very nice..
Overwhelmed by my first experience in Nandan Cinema.
It also has some cafeterias for light snacks.

sources.snippet: Finally, there‚Äôs Baan Thai, a name that most Kolkatans are familiar with, all thanks to the delicious Thai fare offered out here. And while most of us absolutely dig their Thai curries and delicious seafood, did you know that it is also a great spot for a romantic dinner?. After all, keeping aside the mouth-watering concoctions, the ambience of this place is incredibly vibrant, and a total treat for the eyes.

reviews.reviewText: Incredible service from the whole team. I had private authentic floor seating. A candle. And a server that brought me extra spicy sauce, dished my food on my plate, and even gave me a complimentary dessert. It was a bit pricey, but the service, quality of food, and ambience were worth it! Sabita and Tenzing were amazing!!

Baan Thai at Grand Oberoi Kolkata is a delightful Thai restaurant that offers an authentic taste of Thailand right in the heart of the city. The cozy ambiance, attentive service, and exquisite flavors make it a must-visit for Thai food enthusiasts. From traditional Pad Thai to flavorful curries, each dish is prepared with precision and care, ensuring a memorable dining experience. Don't miss the opportunity to indulge in their delicious offerings and transport your taste buds to the vibrant streets of Thailand

Good Thai foods in town. However you might not get authentic taste of Thai food here. Prices are a bit high comparing to the portion n quality you will get.
Recommend for foreigners who never tried Thai food before.

We've had dinner on 9th November and it was out of this world. Tenzing took care of us. He suggested a lovely starter and we have had Yellow prawn curry as suggested by Aditya earlier on. The cocktail was fantastic and service was excellent. We went to Ban Thai for breakfast this morning as 363 was busy. We had a fabulous service, awesome food and brilliant ambience. We are happy and will visit again. Aditya and Tenzing are part of a great team. Even the Chef came to our table and his preparation was wonderful. All the young men and the lady were very polite, kind and thoroughly professional. We wish them all well in their future venture.
Thoroughly enjoyed the Thai food at this restaurant. We did not have a reservation. The staff still accommodated us. It is clean and quiet place. I will be going back there in the future

Very delicious thai food. The steamed fish in lime and ginger sauce was light and refreshing. The staff were the nicest - super attentive without being overwhelming. Made excellent recommendations based on my preference. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for an authentic thai place in Kolkata.

This place is a gem. A slightly overpriced place but the food is an absolute Thai experience.  The starter on pork ,the Thai yellow curry and the desert with coconut milk makes you feel somewhere in Kraby itself. The service is also very good.

I loved the food here. The soup was light but flavourful. Kai Yang was really tasty. The green curry was watery and little intense in flavour for my taste. But overall I will give 4.6 stars. I will recommend this restaurent if you love Thai food. You will taste the authentic Thai flavours here.

Dining was awesome , prices are a bit higher but it's food quality and quantity is worth the money there are many signature dishes like Murg Lemon grass Potli , Murg Rosali kebab,

Just awesome and unique.

Visited this place for the first time and to be honest I was highly satisfied with the quality and taste of the food that was served .
First we ordered Mocktails:

Loved their food,and a must visit place for all foodies.

Highly recommended.

Ticked this off my wish list last week. It was a long due and much awaited visit and I was not disappointed with how things panned out.
The interiors is very cosy and seating comfortable.
The staff are knowledgeable and courteous.
The menu is diverse, food is presented very uniquely and the tase is sublime!
My own let down was the fact that I couldn‚Äôt have Prawn Malaicurry which was not available that day. Alas!

Loved the food! We were staying nearby this restaurant and decided to try it out as our hotel staff suggested us, and we were really happy that we heard him and did try this place.
The food is really good, finger licking!
Went here for 2 days then...called for punjabi food the first day and some chinese the 2nd.
Both the cuisines were well made and perfected the taste as needed!
Decently placed in terms of the cost not that cheap not too expensive.
Definitely recommended! Must visit this place.
Bollywood themed restaurant. Cool decors. Name of Bollywood characters behind every staff. Unique presentation. Bit high on price. Quality and taste okay. Perfect molecular gastronomy experience.

Worth a mention. A very good dining experience. The staff is courteous. The pleasant atmosphere just adds to it. Conviniently located near to maidan metro station. Coming to the food, the galouti kebab is ossam. The pan and the deserts are worth a mention. A definitely try out destination for all. Price is high but food taste is superb.

This is gem of a resturant near british deputy high commission. The foods are nice but they are famous for their presentation of food.Most of them having unique style which is very refreshing. The behaviour of the stuffs are very nice. The decor is also attractive. A bit costly still worth it.

This restaurant was one of the pioneers in molecular gastronomy in Kolkata. Nowadays many such restaurants have emerged but this one set the standard and raised the bar. The ambience is good, Bollywood films style thus living up to its reputation. The service too is good. The staff are well mannered, though they goofed up on service of one item but they behaved well and admitted to the mistake.Food is top notch.

Amazing place where you can enjoy food using your sense of vision and sense of taste. All the items we tried were really good. We liked the starters so much that we didn't order mains and directly ate dessert. The dessert was also really yummy. Though we were full before the dessert, no one could stop eating it.
The staff is very courteous and responsive. We got our orders very quickly. It is slightly difficult to find the place, though. I'd really love to go there again.

placeMetadata.name: Tamara

sources.snippet: Being in the lone company of your loved one, having some of best views of the city with the best food that the city has to offer, the concept does seem like the planning of a perfect date. Treat yourself to the same when you make a visit to the Tamara restaurant. Known for its astounding ambiance and plush setting, this place is perfect for a romantic dinner.
sources.shortName: 23 Places To Visit In Kolkata For Couples, Places For Couples In Kolkata

placeMetadata.description: World flavours combine on the menu of this atmospheric hotel restaurant.
placeMetadata.address: Pipal Tree Hotel, AS/464, Hatiara,Major Arterial Road, Noapara, Sukanta Pally, Rajarhat, West Bengal 700157, India

reviews.reviewText: A very elaborate menu but also very tasty. I had both breakfast and lunch here and they knocked it out of the park. I had Hilsa and home styled chicken. Fantastic dishes both.  The quality and quantity are both top notch. They also serve a nice chocolate pan at the end. The chicken was the stand out for me. Hilsa was authentic too.

If you‚Äôre a foodie like me, you‚Äôll love this place! The menu has a fantastic selection of dishes, and it was a buffet during festive season, we went on saptami evening with friends and families. We loved everything we tried. The menu offers a wide variety of options, and everything we tried was delicious. We only had good comments about the food and services. Ambiances was giving a good vibes. Recommended.

Nice ambience, decoration and food quality. We tried Murg Tikka Peshawari (‚Çπ495) which was very good, chickens were juicy and tasty. Lighting is romantic and candles provided in each table. Must go in evening rather in day time because of ambience. Good for both couples and family. Price is costly.

We had a buffet lunch yesterday. The starters were definitely great. Both veg and non veg options were delicious. But the main course and dessert section were big letdowns. The mutton biriyani and chicken dish had almost no seasoning. The fish in cilantro sauce was salty. Desserts were not good either. Only gulab jamun was okay even if they were a little too soft making it mushy.

The location is superb, 2nd floor of Pipal tree, lift available. The ambience is good but in the main course mutton items are not present. Almost 30 people can gather in a single time.  Items in the desert are also less.

Had gone for lunch. Their buffet contains superficial/limited choices and most of the items are without any test. Even desserts are of sub-standard quality and only to boast the list of items being served.
Not at all recommended. Not a value proposition

Nice place to visit. The dark ambience with the subtle candlelight is just cherry on the top. We asked the staff about the meaning of the word 'Tamara' and he explained it very beautifully. There was a slight problem with the payment system but they resolved it in time. Overall a good experience.

Had been there to celebrate the NYE with my husband and had an amazing experience there. We were looking for a place, a bit cozy yet less crowded. And it was just perfect. We had been to Tamara once before and then also we had an amazing experience.
The staff members take the best care of the guests with a prompt service.
Food was amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed every dish. Tamara specializes in continental dishes. So, we mostly had those dishes. I would recommend this place if you love continental food. And the best part, the staff members always help guests to choose the best dishes.
Last but not least, the place had a beautiful ambience.
Overall experience 9/10

sources.snippet: The perfect spot for a serene brunch and an out-of-the-world gastronomical experience. PSA: Their hazelnut mouse is to die for.
sources.shortName: 6 Of The Most Romantic Spots In Kolkata So You Don't Disappoint Your Date

reviews.reviewText: It was a good place, with positive vibes and luxurious feeling .Although no Indian Food variety is served here , only Authentic Italian Food is served here ...Service was okay ... Employee were little untrained but it was okay üëç

We went with very high expectations,it didn't quite hit that mark.
It is a decent enough experience.
The Tapas Platter was good value for money. The ravioli & roast chicken were fab. The cheesecake was a complete trash.
The drinks,I must say are great.
You can go just for the drinks.
Service is very lax,we waited for a good 30-40 minutes before anyone came to take our order,that too we had to call them,and we went at a very lean time too.
They are charging 10% for service, shouldn't they maintain basic standards.
Considering the atmosphere is great,the food is decent,the drinks exquisite,the service is what leaves a bad taste in the mouth.
Can't say I will visit again,or will recommend to anyone else either.
Beautiful place for hangout with family and friends if you wish to try some authentic Italian foods...

We went with very high expectations,it didn't quite hit that mark.
It is a decent enough experience.
The Tapas Platter was good value for money.
The drinks,I must say are great.
You can go just for the drinks.
Service is very lax,we waited for a good 30-40 minutes before anyone came to take our order,that too we had to call them,and we went at a very lean time too.
They are charging 10% for service, shouldn't they maintain basic standards.
Considering the atmosphere is great,the food is decent,the drinks exquisite,the service is what leaves a bad taste in the mouth.
Can't say I will visit again,or will recommend to anyone else either.

Hello foodies,

Here are the reason why you like The Salt House.

Ambience:

The ambience is soothing. It has a roof top and a covered restaurant. If you love a place under the open sky. You must visit this place. Well decorated place with wooden furnitures. You can arrange a birthday party here, even decorate your date. The pics are attached.

Food:

Since we are into continental delicacies, we had ordered some Italian and Spanish delicacies. They really served excellent food. We loved the taste and quality of the food. You must try their desserts. They are palatable.

Again I forgot what we ate.

Staff:

They are always at your service. There is an incident that proved how dedicated staff they are. Every time I turned back to click photos, the staffs thought that we were looking for them. Every time they came to assist us. ü§£ü§£

P.S: must try Hazelnut mousse. Alaska. Pizza. Don't try parfait.

If you find my review helpful, kindly like it and follow me here and on Instagram (@awrijit). Peace n ‚ù§.

I went with great expectations. But the place couldn't match up to it.
The preparations looked great, but the food wasn't exceptional or something i hadn't had elsewhere. Had the roasted chicken. And the pasta.The seafood risotto and the cheesecake, which couldn definitely be better.
Also the staff didn't know English or Bengali in the place.
The ambience is very elegant and beautiful although wouldn't visit again because it over priced af

Nice place with good food. It was pretty empty at Friday lunch so no waiting time. Tried the guacamole toast which was okay. I felt the lemon was a bit over powering. We also took the pan fried bhetki which was good and had a mild flavor profile. They had a nice cocktail menu but may be for another day.

Great place in terms of both ambience and food. We had shikanji, chicken and cheddar sliders, grilled pizza, cheese croquettes and belgian tart. Food is super delicious!
Just did not get the outdoor seating as there was a private party going on.
Rest no complaints! Will visit this place again and again. ‚ò∫

Overall it‚Äôs a nice place for dine in. Good food good music and great ambience. We ordered a chicken slider, barbecue chicken pizza and a tex Ned bowl which is usually a Mexican rice bowl & orange juice. The food was really good, and fast service. They have indoor and outdoor seating, make sure to call ahead and make a reservation for the outdoor seating.

One of the finest place to have a continental meal in Kolkata. The place is divided in open air section, family dining zone & a shisha zone. Menu is full of lip smacking delicacies & exotic cocktails. You might feel a slight pinch in your pocket but you will not regret it. Ambience is great & service is top notch. Definitely try out dessert section.

placeMetadata.name: Afraa Lounge

sources.snippet: Talking of the experience of buffet dining in Kolkata, there is no better place than Afraa Restaurant and Lounge. Though a joint that cannot be visited without prior booking, this place definitely does justice to the effort. Treat your special someone to the luxury of this spectacular restaurant and make them realize the place that they hold in your life.
sources.shortName: 23 Places To Visit In Kolkata For Couples, Places For Couples In Kolkata

placeMetadata.description: Mediterranean, Asian & Indian dishes are offered in a lavish space with artwork & plush furnishings.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Afraa Lounge is a luxurious dining destination in Kolkata, offering a diverse range of Mediterranean, Asian, and Indian cuisine. The restaurant boasts lavish decor with artwork and plush furnishings, creating a warm and romantic ambiance perfect for special occasions. Located on the rooftop of Salt Lake City Centre 1, it provides stunning views from one of the highest points in the mall. Guests can indulge in buffet dining experiences by making prior reservations to ensure an unforgettable culinary journey.
placeMetadata.address: 6th Floor, City Centre Mall, G-Block, Sector 1, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700064, India

reviews.reviewText:
Visited this lounge on Saturday evening with my family. We ordered a variety of dishes, starting with appetizers, moving on to a bit of the main course, and ending with some delicious desserts. Everything was served with great care and presentation.

The staffs were exceptionally pleasant, amiable, and attentive. They recommended their special dishes based on our preferences. Since some of my family members are seniors, the staff took time to engage with them, understand their tastes, and make suitable suggestions accordingly.

The ambiance of the lounge was unique‚Äîslightly dim, as is typical for such places‚Äîbut upon our request, they brightened the space a bit so we could take some photos. Since we were with children, the staff made adjustments to ensure a comfortable and family-friendly atmosphere.

We also ordered a gin cocktail and a few mocktails, all of which were expertly crafted and incredibly flavorful. We ended up staying longer than expected as some of our relatives arrived late, but the staff remained kind, patient, and cooperative throughout.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience‚Äîfrom the food and drinks to the ambiance and hospitality. Highly recommended!

If you want to have an amazing fine dining experience at saltlake area then Afraa lounge would be one of the best choices for you. It is located at the 6th floor of CC1 mall. Great ambiance, professional staff , delicious food . We celebrated birthday party there with few numbers of teenagers and the staffs were very cooperative and careful about them. Had a great experience over there.

Food was too good and so was the service. What I did not liked was their table which was quite low. Probably the one were I sat.

I would like to return back to try their continental dishes since the Indian dishes we tried were all mouth watering and finger licking.

A bit overpriced.

The food was average at best, and the only thing any of us liked was the funghi pizza . All other items were mostly average or even slightly below average. Their food game needs major improvement maybe their Italian is better I don't know. The pizza was undoubtedly good.
The drinks were all great, I think the pricing is fine although cocktail prices are a little on the higher end. Moreover the service was pretty slow even though it was not fully packed. Will give them another chance sometime but for a bill of about 8k for 6 people you would expect better food and service.

They make the most fabulous cocktails and have a well-stocked bar. Their grazing tables on booking are really good too - the Mezze is fantastic.
The lounge is pretty big and open for dining a la carte as well as private bookings. There‚Äôs an outdoor area for smoking.
Parking is always available since it‚Äôs adjacent to the city centre 1 mall.

This place is located just at the city centre 1 (CC1) bidhannagar saltkake. You can reach here by auto or bus but mostly by metro from Sealdah.

At the ground floor there is coffee shop and at 6th floor, there is dinning area. The place has a very unique sitting arrangements with pure fine dinning arrangements.

The place serves a wide range of cuisine, but mostly indian. Price is very competitive to the taste and quantity.

we tried their
malai tikka kebab
mutton ghost biryani
chicken korma
butter naan
watermelon mojito
berry blast mojito

biryani was disappointing but. other items were very nice. loved their drinks a lot along naan and chicken.

Service was slow but stiingwas very good along atmosphere.
naan was decent, biryani was very bad in taste,

We are coming here for more than 20 years now and we always vouch for the quality of food and ambience. Today we were taken care by Amit . He was very decent, well behaved and served us with utmost care. We loved ur hospitality Amit. Thank you. Afraa is our go to place

There r few joints called perfect and there is this place brings that but more than excellent food, ambience or vibe to offer - this place offers hospitality at its best with the connect with their customers. Affra has been my post work go to place since last 4 years and everytime the team has amused me with their personal touch.

Was there to celebrate my wife‚Äôs birthday which was a drinks and dinner privy plan, which #Amit and team made memorable for me & my wife with their calm gesture of our specialised cake gesture which made it to our memory board for lifetime.

Special shout-out to Amit, Floor manager/s and all the team members at Affra lounge Saltlake for their effort they always make to put a smile. & also thanks again to team & chef for making my wife‚Äôs birthday subtly memorable.

Kudos to chef team for that smile and taking time out for the pic together. :)

Wish u all the best

placeMetadata.name: AltAir - Capella

sources.snippet: Yes, we are a little biased towards rooftop seating, and why shouldn‚Äôt we be?. After all, there‚Äôs nothing better than relishing your dinner under the canopy of stars, with your significant other right by your side.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

placeMetadata.description: Versatile dishes & cocktails in a fashionable venue that has panoramic city views.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: AltAir - Capella is a rooftop restaurant located on the 20th floor of AltAir Boutique Hotel in Kolkata, offering stunning panoramic views of the city. The venue features a restobar-kitchen-brewery-skybar concept with gourmet plated delights, live entertainment, and a full bar serving sumptuous cocktail snack options. Additionally, Rendezvous, an upscale French cafe at Altair, combines Haute French cuisine with Pondicherry influences for a unique dining experience.
placeMetadata.address: Ambuja Neotia EcoCentre, 20th Floor, EM-4, Street No. 13, EM Block, Sector V, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700091, India

reviews.reviewText:
This is one of the few experiences that will stay with you forever. Right from the beginning we are awestruck by the interiors of the place. Every corner was picture worthy!!

So I won't dare to say anything bad about this place. Love it so much!!

Coming to the food we thought that the wait time was a bit too long though it might have been due to the high demand as we went on 1st January this year.

Food quality wise this was great and tasty too.

Finally I would love to come back here again and again.

I recently visited AltAir - Capella and had a mixed experience. The food was just okay, nothing particularly impressive or memorable.

However, the view from the restaurant was absolutely stunning! It's definitely a great spot to enjoy a meal with a beautiful backdrop.

Unfortunately, the ambience didn't quite live up to my expectations. The music was too loud and didn't seem to match the atmosphere of the restaurant. It felt a bit disjointed and took away from my overall experience.

Overall, I would recommend AltAir - Capella for its amazing view, but perhaps not for its food or ambience. Maybe they can work on improving those aspects to make it a more well-rounded experience.
Their restaurant is full of tasty food with lesser options on the menu. I really liked the ambience and the staff are very cordial and polite. The pool side view was worth it.

The Altair Hotel was clean and comfortable. The room was well maintained. The view from the room and rooftop was especially nice. The breakfast was great. The staff was friendly. The only thing that was disappointing was the jacuzzi on the rooftop. We booked this place because we saw the pool on the rooftop. And we thought we could use the jacuzzi if it was too cold to use the pool. The staff explained that the pool and jacuzzi were in operation. Unfortunately, the water in the pool was cold and we couldn't swim. So we went to the jacuzzi. The jacuzzi seemed to be filled with old cold water. The water wasn't heated and the jacuzzi didn't work. There were bugs and dust floating on the water. I was very disappointed in that. It's dishonest to advertise a jacuzzi that isn't maintained.

Salt Lake's most gorgeous roof top cafe is AltAir. High upon 19th floor in Sector V, it offers a magnificent view of city's eastern part. Dinning on the open terrace is an experience to remember. Though food is a bit pricey, you can enjoy the evening breeze with a sip to your favourite liquor or cocktail.
This roof top lounge really has awesome views. We got a group place at the corner for 360 view. Sound was loud, so they can think of keeping it moderate so people can talk. Foods are tasty.

The staff went above and beyond to make our stay special. So helpful and friendly..thank you all staff nd all members,this is memorable nd luxury hotelüôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèªThis hotel is my happy place. Definitely coming back soon‚ù§Ô∏èüíØüíØüíØ

I have an obsession with rooftop restaurants and cafes it's actually the main reason I chose Capella to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. The food was good, the staff were very polite and professional, and the service was quick, which I really appreciated.

However, I was disappointed that they weren‚Äôt serving in the open rooftop area. For some reason, it wasn't accessible, and that kind of defeated the whole purpose of choosing this place. I specifically picked Capella for the rooftop view, so it was a bit of a letdown. If you're going for the rooftop experience, you might want to check in advance whether it's available.

placeMetadata.name: Glook The Sky Lounge

sources.snippet: Next, our hunt for the best romantic restaurants in Kolkata took us to Glook - The Sky Lounge, which is yet another excellent open-air venue, perfect for a date night. First things first, its rooftop setting is super-romantic, especially during evenings. Not to mention, the majestic view it offers is a sight to behold.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

placeMetadata.description: Indoor-outdoor rooftop haunt offering drinks & regional plates amid a chic, contemporary atmosphere.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Glook The Sky Lounge is a stylish indoor-outdoor rooftop venue in Kolkata, offering regional dishes and drinks in a chic setting. It's popular for romantic evenings due to its open-air ambiance and stunning views, especially at night. The lounge features lavish interior design and provides breathtaking vistas of the city. With various indoor and outdoor seating options, it's an ideal spot for a romantic date or special celebration.
placeMetadata.address: 5th Floor, The Terminus, BG-12, BG Block(Newtown), Action Area I, Newtown, New Town, West Bengal 700156, India

reviews.reviewText:
One of the best place in newtown to vibe on with friends or colleague or loved ones. Great ambiance and food is great with good music. They have a dance floor. In their sky lounge you get a amazing view of new town.
And the behaviour of the staffs are nice and polite.

Very well located and a nice place, but the rooftop area being closed for now half the charm of the place is  gone. Also on the day of our visit the main restaurant area was fully reserved so we were seated in a dimly lit claustrophobic area. So better to call and confirm about seating area before visiting. The starter items were very good also north Indian items. Biriyani was a disaster. Some cocktails were very good, some average. So a mixed experience this time. Special mention ..all the staff, very well behaved and friendly

Glook The Sky Lounge is a fantastic spot in Kolkata, offering a unique blend of Indian and continental cuisine. Located on the 5th floor of The Terminus in Newtown, this rooftop cafe provides breathtaking views of the city skyline.

The ambiance is modern and chic, with comfortable seating arrangements perfect for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends. They also have outdoor seating, takeaway, and delivery options available.

Their menu features a variety of dishes, including Chinese, North Indian, and Continental cuisine. Some popular items include Spaghetti Aglio E Olio, Mocktail, Fish, Chicken Afghani Tandoori, and Ravioli.

Glook The Sky Lounge also boasts a well-stocked bar with an impressive selection of cocktails, soft drinks, and wines. They have live music performances and DJs, making it an excellent spot for celebrations.

In terms of pricing, the average cost for two people is around ‚Çπ2,900, with a pint of beer costing ‚Çπ300 . They also have banquet halls available for events, with a capacity of 250 seats and 350 floating guests.

Overall, Glook The Sky Lounge is a great spot to enjoy delicious food, stunning views, and a lively atmosphere.üíû

Visited Glook Sky Lounge and tried their Mix noodles and Fish in Hot Garlic Sauce. The ambiance of the lounge was fantastic, with a great rooftop view and a lively atmosphere. The service was prompt and courteous.

The Mix Chow was well-prepared, with a nice balance of flavors and a good mix of vegetables and protein. However, it could have been slightly spicier for my taste. The Fish in Hot Garlic Sauce was the highlight of the meal‚Äîperfectly cooked fish with a flavorful, garlicky kick that paired well with the sauce. The portion sizes were decent, making it a satisfying meal overall.

Overall, Glook Sky Lounge offers a great dining experience, especially for those who enjoy a good mix of flavors and a vibrant setting. I‚Äôd definitely recommend it for a casual night out!

Rating: 4/5

We recently visited Glook and had a great experience. The food was of good quality, and the service was equally impressive‚Äîprompt and courteous. One of the highlights was the excellent ambiance, which added to the overall dining experience.

Another plus point is the availability of free basement parking, making it convenient for guests. Overall, Glook is a great place to enjoy good food in a fantastic setting. Would definitely recommend it!

One of the standout spots in Kolkata‚Äôs New Town, this place truly impresses with its ambiance, atmosphere, and surrounding views. The combination of great music and stunning vibes makes it a perfect destination to unwind.

The food was delicious, and the hookah was exceptional‚Äîdefinitely a highlight of the experience. Whether you‚Äôre planning a date or looking to chill with friends, this spot offers the ideal setting for a memorable time. Highly recommended!

One of the best hangout place in NewTown with impressive ambience, great rooftop view. Food quality was top notched with prompt Service.
Highly recommended for  weekend chill, romantic date, friends night out..
You can try to book/pay from Swiggy DineIn app for discount.
Nice ambiance at the rooftop with good music. Service was decent. They took almost 45 minutes to serve dinner (main course) but the food was freshly served.

ops.insert: Elegant, domed, white marble museum, opened in 1921, housing displays on the history of Kolkata.
A large recreation area for activities such as boating & cycling, plus a playground, lake & gardens.
Serene parkland features an artificial lake & over 70-acres of green space with shade trees & paths.
Scenic shoreline park with balustrades overlooking the water, landscaped gardens & amusement rides.
Green space featuring a jogging/walking path, a pond & benches frequented by couples.
Indian heritage museum with sections on archaeology, art, anthropology and geology, founded in 1814.
Continental restaurant with a sophisticated atmosphere, outdoor seating & Sunday brunch.
Bustling cantilever road bridge opened since 1943 and spanning the Hooghly River.
Stately, 19th-century private residence with unique art & landscaped grounds, plus guided tours.

Central Park situated in Salt Lake is a public urban park. It is also known as Banabitan. It is the third largest open space in Kolkata Metropolitan Area after the Maidan and Eco Park. This park is easily reachable from the Karunamoyee Bus Terminus in Salt Lake. Wikipedia.

Kolkata Race Course is a horse race venue in Hastings, Kolkata, India. It is the largest horse race venue in India. The race course was built in 1820 and is maintained by the Royal Calcutta Turf Club.
The races are held from the month of July to September, and again from November to March. Wikipedia.
9 ornate spires top this riverside red and cream 1800s temple, with shrines to Krishna and Vishnu.
Prominent city thoroughfare featuring historic sites, boutiques, cafes & a vibrant nightlife.
Major, 66,000-capacity cricket ground hosting Indian Premier League and international matches.
This sprawling, 18th-century Christian graveyard features large, picturesque tombstones.

Maidan is a massive green space with trails, riverside picnic spots, and sporting venues that include the iconic Eden Gardens cricket ground, golf courses, and a polo club. Set in stately landscaped gardens, Victoria Memorial is a white-domed museum displaying Indian and Western art. St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral is a neo-Gothic landmark from 1847. Family attractions include Nehru Children‚Äôs Museum and M.P. Birla Planetarium.
Ancestral home of the historic Tagore family, now a museum spotlighting its members‚Äô lives.
Hotel buffet restaurant with floor-to-ceiling windows & garden views serving Indian & global items.
This swanky open-air lounge on the roof of The Lindsay serves cocktails & a range of global dishes.
Northern Indian cuisine with an open kitchen in an upscale hotel restaurant.
Landmark Anglican church completed in 1847, with restored steeple and notable stained glass windows.
This stylish Thai restaurant in The Oberoi Grand is  decorated with native motifs & carved wood.
Mediterranean, Asian & Indian dishes are offered in a lavish space with artwork & plush furnishings.
Retail store featuring the brand's signature athletic footwear, clothes & accessories.
World flavours combine on the menu of this atmospheric hotel restaurant.
Vibrant terrace seating pub & restaurant with multicuisine options & sports screenings.
Opened in 1972, this children's museum includes 4 floors of galleries & dolls from around the world.
Compact, palm-dotted park popular for sunset watching, with restaurants, paths & animals.
Versatile dishes & cocktails in a fashionable venue that has panoramic city views.
Indoor-outdoor rooftop haunt offering drinks & regional plates amid a chic, contemporary atmosphere.
Lunch and dinner-opening restaurant for a familiar range of dishes from the north of the country.

New Town is a planned Satellite city of Kolkata in the Indian state of West Bengal. It is administered by NKDA. New Town is declared as a "Solar City" and "Smart Green City" by Government of India. Wikipedia.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Kolkata, a city steeped in history and culture, offers a unique blend of romance and charm that makes it a perfect destination for couples. From the serene banks of the Hooghly River to the lush greenery of its parks, the city is dotted with picturesque spots that invite you to create lasting memories with your loved one. Imagine strolling hand-in-hand along the iconic Howrah Bridge, or enjoying a quiet moment by the tranquil waters of Rabindra Sarobar, where the beauty of nature meets the whispers of history.

As you explore Kolkata, you'll discover a delightful mix of well-known landmarks and hidden gems that cater to every romantic whim. Whether it's a cozy dinner at Cafe Ekante overlooking a serene lake or a leisurely afternoon at Eco Park, the city's vibrant atmosphere and rich heritage provide the perfect backdrop for love to blossom. So grab your partner and embark on a journey through the most romantic corners of Kolkata, where every moment is an opportunity to connect and celebrate your love.

data.title: The 50 best photo spots in Kolkata (Calcutta)

placeMetadata.name: Victoria Memorial

sources.snippet: Commissioned by Lord Curzon, the then Viceroy of India, this vast white marble palace was designed to commemorate Queen Victoria‚Äôs demise in 1901. While the main highlights of the inside are the soaring central chamber and the Calcutta Gallery, an excellent, even-handed exhibition tracing the city‚Äôs colonial-era history, the outside renders magnificently photogenic views across reflecting ponds from the northeast and northwest along with a large, well-tended park. You can set the park and outside lawn as your photo-shoot spot with the magnificent piece of white marble as the backdrop.
sources.shortName: 7 Stunning Places in Kolkata for a Romantic Photoshoot

sources.snippet: Like any other person who visits Kolkata, Victoria Memorial is the sight that was on the very top of my to-see list. Built in the early 20th century, this architectural marvel dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria is a true embodiment of Kolkata and its colonial heritage, if you ask me. Being a grand monument made entirely of white Makrana marble (the same as Taj Mahal in Agra) that is situated amidst lush green gardens, Victoria memorial is a photographer‚Äôs dream that keeps on delivering one Instagrammable spot after the other.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Instagrammable Spots In Kolkata

sources.snippet: Imposing white marble Victoria Memorial at the southern end of the Maidan was completed in 1921 and currently serves as a museum. Constructed in memory of Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom, it houses a fine art history collection and a gallery from the British Colonial period including many impressive paintings, sculptures, and books. The building's exterior is evocatively illuminated at night, and its surrounded by a vast garden that's an attraction in itself.
sources.shortName: 18 Best Places to Visit in Kolkata to Discover the City

sources.snippet: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building on Queens Way that was built over a century ago in dedication to the memory of Queen Victoria. Now, it‚Äôs also a museum, but the reason you should come here for street photography isn‚Äôt for the building, but the 64 acres of grounds and gardens surrounding it. There are parks, ponds, and plenty of people walking around here at all times during the day, especially in the evening.
sources.shortName: City Street Guides by f.d. walker: A Street Photography Guide to Kolkata, India

sources.snippet: Just behind Maidan, you will find the crown jewel of Kolkata, Victoria Memorial. Akin to its namesake, this heritage building was built as a memorial to Queen Victoria by Lord Curzon in the year of 1906. This huge central building houses a museum that exhibits guns, bullets, and canons that were used during the First and the Second World Wars, along with other artifacts.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Places to Shoot in Kolkata, a 400-Year-Old Indian City

sources.snippet: The most iconic heritage property in Kolkata, Victoria Memorial is a unique blend of European, Indian and Persian architecture. Choose this white marble wonder along with its 64 acres well-maintained garden and open space as one of the locations for your dreamy and memorable pre-wedding shoot. Image Source: Bireswar Biswas Photography
sources.shortName: 8 Best Locations For Pre Wedding Shoot In Kolkata

sources.snippet: The exhibition of colonial British architecture in the place shall leave you dazzled with its vibe. The aesthetic of the place is further enhanced by the confluence of Indian, Persian and European architecture. A very popular spot for couples can give you some ambient pictures for you to cherish forever.
sources.shortName: 25 Amazing Locations For Pre Wedding Photoshoot In Kolkata

sources.snippet: The place's ambience will amaze you with its exhibition of  British heritage. The fusion of Indian, Persian and European styles adds to the overall appeal of the location. A popular location for couples can give you lots of beautiful pre wedding photographs that you will treasure for a lifetime.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Locations For Pre Wedding Photoshoot In Kolkata

sources.snippet: Victoria Memorial is one of the best pre-wedding locations in Kolkata, making it a perfect addition to the blog on the 28 best locations. Its architectural beauty, reminiscent of the British Raj, offers a captivating backdrop. It is ideal for capturing timeless moments of love and romance.
sources.shortName: 28 Best Locations For Pre Wedding Photoshoot In Kolkata

sources.snippet: The Victoria Memorial is not only a testament to Kolkata‚Äôs colonial past but also a visual treat for photographers. It is one of the top photography places in Kolkata. This grand marble building, surrounded by lush gardens, showcases exquisite architecture and intricate detailing.
sources.siteName: Travel Blog | Travel Inspiration, Tips and News | Travel Diary
sources.shortName: Photography Spots in Kolkata to Unleash the Photographer in You

sources.snippet: This incredible marble building was constructed in the early 1900s in dedication to Queen Victoria. A visit to the museum inside requires several hours and free guided tours are available. However, my favourite part of this site was actually the gardens that surround it.
sources.shortName: The Best Places For Photography In Kolkata

sources.snippet: Victoria Memorial | #1 of 34 Best Places to Visit in Kolkata. An imposing white monument, Victoria Memorial is one of the most visited places in Kolkata, and for all good reasons. Named after Queen Victoria, it now serves as a museum and is perfect for history buffs.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Kolkata (2024): Timing, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: This finest building is a perfect location for a romantic pre wedding photoshoot in Kolkata. The sparkling white marble monument is a symbol of colonial rule in our country. Its Indo-European architecture will add a magical twist to your pre-wedding photoshoot.
sources.shortName: Best Places For Photography In Kolkata You Should Know

sources.snippet: The marble building made in honour of Queen Victoria surely hits the list of 12 Instagrammable places of Kolkata. A huge green garden was built surrounding the building. It is a good spot for a picnic, friend meets and of course, photography.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Kolkata

sources.snippet: Both of these areas are right beside each other but offer completely different vibes. The Memorial, known for its architecture, is ethereal when photographed. It provides an olden-day feel that cannot be easily replicated.
sources.shortName: Places In Kolkata To Click Instagram Photos

sources.snippet: Whether you're staring into each other's eyes on the banks of the Hooghly river or hugging one another with the Victoria Memorial in the backdrop, there are so many pre-wedding shoot locations in Kolkata.
sources.shortName: Bookmark These 20 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Kolkata!

sources.snippet: One of the most popular and sought-after locations in Kolkata. First-timers make sure to visit the Victoria Memorial as first priority.
sources.shortName: 10 Offbeat Instagrammable places in Kolkata, India

placeMetadata.description: Elegant, domed, white marble museum, opened in 1921, housing displays on the history of Kolkata.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Victoria Memorial is an exquisite white marble museum in Kolkata, built in 1921 as a tribute to Queen Victoria. The grand architecture and well-maintained gardens make it a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. Inside, the museum showcases the history of Kolkata and the British Empire in India. It also boasts a remarkable collection of over 5,000 paintings by renowned artists from the Bengal School of Art.
placeMetadata.address: Victoria Memorial Hall, 1, Queens Way, Maidan, Kolkata, West Bengal 700071, India

reviews.reviewText:
Such a marvellous architecture.
A must visit place in Kolkata.
Food & water is not allowed inside the Memorial.
The place is very neat & clean & the information is placed for all the monuments.
This place can be crowded during weekends.
The park outside is amazing during sunset time.
History lover will love this place.
Place has some entry fees also..
If you want save some fare you can come by bus also..

Victoria Memorial is a beautiful place, which can recreate memories of the Britishers and their reigning period. It's a vast place in the heart of the city. The gardens are quite beautiful and it is build up of marble. There are many marble statues of certain rulers of England and many important people. It also includes a museum inside it where there are lots of valuable things from the past including paintings, clothes, etc. The price for entry is ‚Çπ50 (Lawn and Museum), ‚Çπ30 (Lawn only) and ‚Çπ500 (Foreigners). Its huge yes, and there a beautiful place in Kolkata. Recommended for visit.

The Victoria Memorial is one of the most beautiful and grand monuments I‚Äôve visited. The white marble architecture looks stunning, especially during sunrise or sunset when the light hits the domes. The vast gardens around it are well-maintained and perfect for a peaceful walk or to sit and relax.

Inside, the museum offers a fascinating glimpse into colonial history, with impressive paintings, artifacts, and sculptures. The collection is quite large, so it‚Äôs worth taking your time to explore each gallery.

Do plan to spend at least 2‚Äì3 hours here to fully enjoy both the museum and the surrounding gardens. There‚Äôs also a light and sound show in the evening that brings the history of the memorial to life.

Overall, a must-visit place in Kolkata that combines history, architecture, and nature beautifully!

Nice memorial to visit with kids. Neat and clean. The place needs more information guide for visitors. Only one gate is functional. Water bottles not allowed inside. That‚Äôs weird. Overall it‚Äôs a good place to spend some time.

Plan to have a good walk and so have good shoes and also carry umbrella as if it rains then it‚Äôs bad and if it‚Äôs too sunny as well it gets bad.

reviews.reviewText:
Hello visitor, my name is Somnath, I am a Google Verified Local Guide and an adventure lover. I visited Mallik Ghat Flower Market yesterday.
‚Ä¢
Mallik Ghat is one of the most popular places in Kolkata. It is located on the banks of the Hooghly River and below the Howrah Bridge.
‚Ä¢
This is a very beautiful place. More than fifty thousand people come here every day. Because some come to buy flowers from the flower market, and some come to visit this wonderful beautiful place.
‚Ä¢
Mallick Ghat Flower Market is the largest flower market in Kolkata and is one of the most popular places to visit.
‚Ä¢
Mallick Ghat Flower Market is a favorite place for photographers.
‚Ä¢
It would not be wrong to say that the place is the biggest flower market in Kolkata.I solely visited this place for the experience and it was undoubtedly a great one. I had walked all the way under the scorching sun and was tired by the time I reached, but the moment I entered the place it filled me up with energy from the crowd. The place was bustling with people and flowers being sold everywhere. The aroma from the variety of flowers here and there filled up the air with a unheard fragrance. It felt so fresh and the constant bargaining going around everywhere bought a smile to my face.

The place is pretty nice, the only drawback is that the place is a bit dirty and when it rains, the surroundings become a muddy mess.A little maintenance is needed here, then everything will be fine.

A very busy flower market next to historical ghats and iconic Howrah bridge. The prices are low provided you know bargaining skills. Numerous varieties of flowers are available, but get ready to brave the local crowds
One of favourite destination in Kolkata. Must go to place for the people who love flowers. The best time to visit in the early morning specially in winter.

Located beneath the iconic Howrah Bridge, Mullick Ghat Flower Market is one of the oldest and largest flower markets in Asia. Dating back to 1855, it is a vibrant hub where hundreds of vendors gather daily to sell fresh flowers like marigolds, roses, tuberoses, lilies, and lotuses.

The market comes alive as early as 4:00 AM, with peak activity till 8:00 AM. Traders, wholesalers, and buyers from across the city and even from neighbouring states come here to buy flowers for temples, weddings, rituals, and festivals. The air is filled with fragrance, and the pathways are lined with heaps of colourful blooms, creating a visual and sensory treat.

Though crowded and often muddy, the market reflects Kolkata‚Äôs cultural and spiritual rhythm. You‚Äôll see garland-making in action, deals being negotiated, and porters carrying massive flower bundles on their heads. It‚Äôs also a favourite spot for photographers, especially during sunrise with the bridge in the backdrop.

‚úÖ Tips for Visitors:
Best time to visit: Between 5 AM ‚Äì 7 AM

Footwear: Wear closed shoes; the ground is often wet.

Entry: Free, no formal gate or ticket.

Getting there: A short walk from Howrah railway station or Strand Road.

üåü Final Words:
Mullick Ghat Flower Market is not just a market‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience. It‚Äôs where commerce meets culture, and tradition thrives in every petal. A must-visit for those who want to feel the raw, authentic energy of Kolkata.

The must place visit in Kolkata. The place is really good. By morning, you have to visit this place. It is under the Howrah Bridge. All the flowers are very cheap. Here. It is one of the famous wholesale flower market, West Bengal .

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Howrah Bridge, also known as Rabindra Setu, is a bustling cantilever road bridge that spans the Hooghly River, connecting Kolkata and Howrah in Bengal. Built by the British and opened in 1943, it is one of the busiest bridges in India. Despite its age, it is referred to as the 'New Howrah Bridge' and stands as an enduring symbol of Kolkata.

reviews.reviewText:
One of the most iconic landmarks of India!
Howrah Bridge is not just a bridge ‚Äî it‚Äôs a symbol of Kolkata‚Äôs vibrant culture and daily life. The view of the Hooghly River from here is breathtaking, especially during sunrise or sunset. You‚Äôll see thousands of people crossing it every day ‚Äî from local vendors to daily commuters.

It‚Äôs a perfect blend of engineering marvel and historic charm. A must-visit if you're in Kolkata!

üïô Best time to visit: Early morning or evening
üìçPro tip: Walk across the bridge for a real feel of Kolkata's heartbeat

The bridge is a landmark, and it looks absolutely majestic.

A bridge of this size to standing still without any support pillars makes it an engineering marvel.

I just wish it was cleaner. But Kolkata as a city is very dirty itself, so it's not really fair to expect that the bridge will be an exception.
An iconic landmark of Kolkata, Howrah Bridge is a stunning example of engineering and history. Best experienced at sunrise or night when it‚Äôs beautifully lit. A must-see symbol of the city.

The Howrah Bridge, officially known as Rabindra Setu, is not just a bridge‚Äîit is a living icon of Kolkata and one of the most remarkable engineering marvels of India. Standing proudly over the Hooghly River, this cantilever bridge connects the city of Howrah with the heart of Kolkata, carrying millions of people every single day.

What makes the Howrah Bridge truly fascinating is its sheer scale and design. Built without a single nut or bolt, it is held together entirely by rivets, a testament to the brilliance of early 20th-century engineering. Walking or driving across it, you can feel the pulse of the city‚Äîthe endless flow of buses, yellow taxis, rickshaws, and pedestrians all weaving into the daily rhythm of Kolkata life.

Beyond its practical importance, the bridge has immense cultural and emotional value. For many Bengalis, the first glimpse of the Howrah Bridge while entering Kolkata symbolizes ‚Äúhomecoming.‚Äù At night, when the bridge lights up and reflects on the waters of the Hooghly, it transforms into a breathtaking sight‚Äîone that photographers and travelers cherish.

The Howrah Bridge is more than just steel and structure; it is a silent witness to Kolkata‚Äôs history, from the days of British India to modern times. It has seen generations grow, countless stories unfold, and remains one of the busiest bridges in the world.

If you are visiting Kolkata, experiencing the Howrah Bridge‚Äîwhether by walking across it, viewing it from the ghats, or taking a ferry ride underneath‚Äîis an absolute must. It is not only an engineering wonder but also the very soul of the city.

Howrah Bridge is an iconic symbol of Kolkata and a must-visit attraction. This massive steel cantilever bridge spans the Hooghly River, connecting Kolkata and Howrah. Visitors love walking across it to experience the lively local life, colorful vendors, and stunning views of the river and city, especially at sunrise or sunset. Though often crowded, the bustling energy and historic charm make it a memorable part of any Kolkata visit. At night, it looks breathtakingly beautiful when lit up. The bridge is also known for its unique construction without nuts or bolts, held together by rivets. Overall, it‚Äôs a timeless landmark that perfectly captures Kolkata‚Äôs spirit.

üü¢What I likedüü¢
1. The bridge itself is solid and impressive ‚Äî built in 1943 using only rivets (no nuts/bolts), which is amazing even today.
2. The view of the Hooghly River from the bridge is beautiful during sunrise or sunset.
3. At night, the lights on the bridge give it a nice glow.
4. It connects the busy Howrah Railway Station with Kolkata city, so it's historically important.
5. For people interested in raw city life, walking across it feels like stepping into Kolkata‚Äôs real daily rhythm.

üî¥What I didn‚Äôt like (and others should know)üî¥

6. The surrounding area is one of the dirtiest I‚Äôve seen ‚Äî garbage, spit, urine ‚Äî it‚Äôs everywhere.
7. It‚Äôs overcrowded with honking traffic, vendors, and people rushing in every direction.
8. No one follows traffic rules, and there‚Äôs zero lane discipline.
9. Ola and taxi drivers around the area are known for overcharging, refusing to turn on the AC, and behaving rudely.
10. If you still want to go, visit early morning or late evening ‚Äî it's slightly better and less crowded then.

I personally loved this place, structure of this Bridge was absolutely astonishing. I went their in the evening, night view of this bridge was stunning. It's a perfect place for street photography, as a Bangladeshüáßüá© tourist i click lots good street photo this bridge. I recommended that you should go early to find some subject for photography.

It is such a great experience to see and travel on the bridge. It looks good in the morning and also in the night with the lights. The view from the bridge of the city is so good. There are so many people who travel on the bridge daily. The bridge is clean and neat. We need to see the bridge from the nearest ghat fornthe clear view of the whole bridge.

reviews.reviewText:
St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral is a must-visit for those who appreciate history, architecture and tranquility. With an entry fee of ‚Çπ10, this iconic church offers a peaceful and serene atmosphere that makes you feel instantly at ease.

The Gothic-style architecture is truly stunning with high ceilings, intricate stained-glass windows, and beautifully designed interiors. While photography is not allowed inside, the experience of just sitting there in silence, soaking in the calmness is worth it.

Whether you‚Äôre visiting for prayer, history or just some quiet time, St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral is a perfect escape from the city's hustle. Highly recommended for a peaceful and reflective experience!

St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral in Kolkata is a majestic symbol of Indo-Gothic architecture and colonial heritage. Completed in 1847, it was the first Anglican cathedral built in Asia and remains the seat of the Diocese of Calcutta. Designed by Major William Nairn Forbes and architect C.K. Robinson, its towering spire, pointed arches, and stained-glass windows reflect a blend of Gothic Revival and Indian adaptations suited to the local climate. Located on Cathedral Road near Victoria Memorial and Birla Planetarium, the cathedral is surrounded by lush gardens and offers a serene retreat from the city‚Äôs bustle. Inside, visitors find a high-vaulted nave, intricate woodwork, and frescoes depicting the life of St. Paul.

An architectural masterpiece!
Visiting St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral was an unforgettable experience. The grandeur of the dome, the intricate details in the interior, and the peaceful ambiance make it truly breathtaking. The Whispering Gallery is a unique highlight, and the panoramic view from the top is worth every step. The staff were warm and welcoming, and the entire place is well-maintained. Highly recommend booking tickets in advance to make the entry smooth and hassle-free. A must-visit for history, architecture, and photography lovers!

A Quiet Slice of Heaven in the Heart of Kolkata

If you‚Äôre wandering about Kolkata and fancy a spot of peace and beauty, St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral is the place to be. For just ‚Çπ10, you‚Äôre welcomed into a world of calm that feels miles away from the city‚Äôs buzz.

The architecture is a sight to behold-grand Gothic arches, lofty ceilings, and stained-glass windows that catch the light just right. It‚Äôs not about flashy photos here (they don‚Äôt allow them inside), but rather about the hush in the air, the stillness that settles over you the moment you step in.

It‚Äôs a place to reflect, to breathe, to simply sit and let time slow down. Whether you‚Äôre there for a prayer or just to marvel at the history, this cathedral has a quiet charm that stays with you.

A soul-soothing stop, and one I‚Äôd recommend to anyone craving a bit of grace and serenity.
